resources.string: The first and most widely known cryptocurrency, Bitcoin enables peer-to-peer digital money transfers with no central authority.
Ethereum is a programmable blockchain platform that supports smart contracts and decentralized applications; ETH is its native token used to pay for computation and transaction fees.
Polkadot is a multi-chain protocol designed to connect different blockchains, allowing them to interoperate; DOT is its token used for governance, staking and bonding.
XRP is the native digital asset of the XRP Ledger, used for fast, low-cost cross-border payments and liquidity provisioning without relying on traditional correspondent banking.
Tether (USDT) is a stablecoin pegged to the US dollar, designed to maintain a 1:1 value and serve as a bridge between crypto and fiat for stability.
Binance Coin (BNB) is the native token of the Binance ecosystem, used for trading fee discounts, governance, staking, and powering Binance’s blockchain infrastructure.
Originally created as a “meme coin,” Dogecoin has gained popularity and utility with a strong community, being used for tipping and micropayments.
